cards.title: Children queuing for supplements killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, hospital says
cards.summary: Children queuing for supplements killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, hospital says. Israeli military said it struck a "Hamas terrorist" and regretted any harm to civilians. US-based aid group Project Hope said the attack was a blatant violation of international law.

cards.title: 'A huge explosion-like sound' - Survivors recall moment India bridge collapsed
cards.summary: 'A huge explosion-like sound' - Survivors recall moment India bridge collapsed 19 hours ago. At least 15 people have said that they initially thought it was an explosion or earthquake. The cause of the collapse is still to be ascertained, and investigations are under way

cards.title: Search for survivors after Houthis sink second Red Sea cargo ship in a week
cards.summary: Ten crew members have been rescued and at least three others killed after a cargo ship was attacked by Yemen's Houthis. The Liberian-flagged, Greek-operated Eternity C was carrying 25 crew when it sustained significant damage and lost all propulsion after being hit by rocket-propelled grenades fired from small boats on Monday.

cards.title: Secret Service suspended staff for failings in Trump assassination attempt
cards.summary: Secret Service suspended staff for failings in Trump assassination attempt last year. Staff given penalties ranging from 10 to 42 days of leave without pay or benefits. One of Matthew Crooks's bullets grazed the ear of Trump, who was rushed to safety.

cards.title: 'Trump was right' - John Kerry says Democrats allowed migrant 'siege' of US border
cards.summary: John Kerry says Democrats allowed migrant 'siege' of US border to be 'under siege' during Joe Biden's presidency. Kerry was the Democratic presidential nominee in 2004 and a US senator from Massachusetts. He said Democrats had "missed" on immigration for years.

cards.title: EU chief von der Leyen survives rare confidence vote
cards.summary: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen survived a confidence vote tabled by a far-right faction in the European Parliament. Only 175 MEPs voted in favour; 360 voted against and 18 abstained. The remaining MEPs did not vote.

cards.title: 'We're worried about our future': Srebrenica massacre's tensions still felt 30 years on
cards.summary: More than 8,000 Bosnian men and boys were killed by Bosnian Serb forces in July 1995. The Srebrenica massacre remains the most notorious war crime committed in Europe since World War Two. Many victims of the massacre were identified by their clothing.

cards.title: 'I can't drink the water' - life next to a US data centre
cards.summary: Beverley Morris says she can't drink the water in her home because of low water pressure. She believes the construction of a data centre in Mansfield, Georgia, disrupted her private well. The data centre is owned by Meta, the parent company of Facebook. Meta says that being a good neighbour is a priority.

cards.title: Six things Trump should know about Liberia after he praised leader's 'good English'
cards.summary: Liberia was founded by freed African-American slaves in 1822 before declaring independence in 1847. Thousands of black Americans and liberated Africans settled in Liberia during the colonial era. Many Liberians speak with an American accent because of those historical ties to the US.

cards.title: South Africans fear spike in HIV infections as US aid cuts bite
cards.summary: South Africans fear spike in HIV infections as US aid cuts bite bite bite. South Africa's HIV-positive sex workers in South Africa rely on private clinics to get prescriptions and treatments. Many of the clinics closed after US President Donald Trump cut most foreign aid earlier this year.

cards.title: Trump threatens 35% tariffs on Canadian goods
cards.summary: US President Donald Trump has said he will slap a 35% tariff on Canadian goods starting 1 August. The US has already imposed a 25% tariffs on some Canadian goods, and the country is feeling the pain of the Trump administration's global steel, aluminium and auto tariffs.

cards.title: Russia's intensifying drone war is spreading fear and eroding Ukrainian morale
cards.summary: Russia's intensifying drone war is spreading fear and eroding Ukrainian morale, writes Paul Adams. The most intense strikes on Kyiv since June are getting worse, he says. The sound of swarms of approaching drones have sent hardened civilians back to bomb shelters.

cards.title: Watch: Smoke billows from luxury yacht fire in St Tropez
cards.summary: Blaze took place on the Sea Lady II, a 41m boat which sleeps up to 10 guests and can be chartered from €65,000 (£56,000) a week. Firefighters initially struggled to get on board to contain the fire.

cards.title: Original Birkin bag shatters record with £7m sale
cards.summary: Original Birkin bag shatters record with £7m sale at Sotheby's in Paris. The black leather bag was made for singer Jane Birkin in 1985 after she spilled her belongings while sitting next to the boss of luxury fashion house Hermès.

cards.title: Judge blocks Trump's birthright order after Supreme Court ruling
cards.summary: Judge blocks Trump's birthright order after Supreme Court ruling. New Hampshire judge approved a class action lawsuit against Trump's executive order. The White House said the judge's decision was an attempt to circumvent the Supreme Court's clear order against universal relief.

cards.title: Semenya's right to a fair hearing violated - ECHR
cards.summary: Caster Semenya was born with differences of sexual development (DSD) and has been unable to compete in the 800m since World Athletics brought in rules in 2019 restricting testosterone levels for track events from 400m up to the mile. The double 800m Olympic champion won a partial victory at the European Court of Human Rights

cards.title: Brazil vows to match US tariffs after Trump threatens 50% levy
cards.summary: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has said he is ready to match any tariffs imposed on Brazil by the United States. Donald Trump has threatened to impose a 50% import tax on Brazilian goods from 1 August. Trump cited Brazil's treatment of former President Jair Bolsonaro as a trigger for

cards.title: US cuts visa validity for applicants from three African countries
cards.summary: US cuts visa validity for applicants from three African countries. State Department says visa policies remain "subject to ongoing review" Nigeria continues to offer five-year multiple-entry visas to American nationals.
